alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 9:51AM EST until November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent due to excess runoff from continuous light to moderate rainfall through the morning. This includes the Watauga River. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beech Mountain, Sugar Grove, Foscoe, Seven Devils, Valle Crucis, Rominger and Lovill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
